summary: An interview with Stephen Jaffe discussing his campaign for Congress, challenges faced, and his platform.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen interview with two individuals, each in their own setting. On the left, a person wearing headphones and a gray cardigan speaks into a microphone, with a colorful, tech-themed background behind them. On the right, another individual, dressed in a green jacket with a "Jaffe" button, is seated in a room with a bicycle and various items in the background. The text overlay identifies the person on the right as "Stephen Jaffe, Candidate California CD 12" and mentions "#NoMoreFools Day April 1st, 2018." The video transitions to a close-up of Stephen Jaffe, with additional text at the bottom providing his name, title as "Candidate 12th Congressional District - CA (D)," his Twitter handle "@Jaffe4Congress," and the hashtag "#NoMoreFools." The atmosphere is professional and focused on political discussion, with both individuals appearing engaged in the conversation.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with two male speakers, one introducing the other as Stephen Jaffey and thanking him for joining the segment, with a friendly and conversational tone. Stephen replies in kind, expressing his pleasure to be back. The first speaker then remarks on Stephen's tiredness, suggesting he is in the midst of a campaign, prompting Stephen to elaborate on why he decided to run, emphasizing San Francisco's need for a voice in Congress, particularly as the current incumbent is out of touch with her constituents. He states his intention to give San Francisco the voice it deserves and needs in Congress, in summary.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen video call between two individuals. On the left side, a person wearing a gray cardigan and headphones is speaking into a microphone, with a background that includes a colorful poster and a book titled "Chump." On the right side, another individual wearing glasses, a green jacket, and a blue button with the text "Jill Stein" is visible. The background behind this person includes a wall with a decorative item and a shelf with various objects. Throughout the video, both individuals appear to be engaged in a conversation, with the person on the left gesturing with their hands while speaking. The setting suggests a casual and informal atmosphere, likely a discussion or interview. The video maintains a consistent visual style, with no significant changes in the environment or the participants' appearances.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker discussing the political landscape, mentioning San Francisco and the person being replaced, whom he describes as a nationally recognized progressive. The speaker praises the other person's efforts and mentions issues within the Democratic Party, including a lawsuit, requesting more information.  There are no sounds of music or background noise present during this clip.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen video call between two individuals. On the left side, a person with long hair, wearing a gray cardigan and headphones, speaks into a microphone against a backdrop of a colorful, tech-themed poster and a book titled "CHROME." On the right side, an older man with glasses, dressed in a green jacket and a pink shirt, also speaks into a microphone. He wears a blue button with the name "Jaffe" on it. The background behind him includes a bicycle and various objects, creating a casual, home-like atmosphere. The video maintains a consistent setting, with both individuals engaged in conversation, as indicated by their facial expressions and gestures. The split-screen format allows viewers to see both participants simultaneously, emphasizing the interactive nature of the call.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker who is critical of a specific California policy. The speaker describes this policy, mentioning that incumbents who are running for the same office receive an automatic endorsement of the state party. He further notes that the only way to challenge it is for the challenger to collect 20% of the signatures of all the delegates in the relevant district. Overall, the speaker seems concerned.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing glasses and a green jacket with a "Jaffe" button, speaking directly to the camera in a room filled with various objects, including a bicycle and a poster on the wall. The scene transitions to a split-screen format, showing the man on the right and another person on the left, who is wearing headphones and speaking into a microphone. The background of the second person includes a colorful mural and a box of cereal. In the center of the screen, there is a graphic with the text "Stephen Jaffe for Congress" alongside an image of a city skyline at night. The video maintains this split-screen format throughout, with the man in the green jacket continuing to speak on the right side, while the person on the left, wearing headphones, speaks into the microphone. The graphic in the center remains consistent, emphasizing the political campaign for Stephen Jaffe.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker describing an event, mentioning turning in signatures and being told they were not enough because "the state party said it was using a list with more delegates." His tone is conversational and informative, explaining how "they changed the rules after the game was over." Another male speaker responds, saying, "Sure, they cheated." The first speaker replies, "Well, thank you," then summarizes that the litigation is about them not being able to change the rules. He concludes that this "that's the substance of the lawsuit."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen video call between two individuals. On the left, a person wearing headphones and a gray cardigan speaks into a microphone, set against a backdrop of a colorful mural and a box of cereal. On the right, another individual in a green jacket with a "Jaffie" button speaks, with a room containing a bicycle and a poster in the background. Between them, a graphic displays four policy areas: "Peace at Home and Abroad," "Single Payer Health Care," "Campaign Finance Reform," and "Fight Climate Change," each accompanied by relevant imagery. The video transitions to a close-up of the person on the right, who continues to speak. The split-screen reappears, now showing a graphic with two images: one of a protest sign reading "Justice For All" and another of two individuals holding a sign that says "Healthcare for the 99%." The video maintains a professional and informative atmosphere, focusing on political and social issues.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker acknowledging something and then asking a question. A second male speaker responds, talking about expense and time, and how he feels it's important for progressives not to cave in when certain tactics are used, alluding to a nationwide policy to keep incumbents in office and suppress progressive challengers. He states that he is one of those progressives, mentions a colleague, and alleges cheating kind of allegations, emphasizing that it's important for progressives to stand up. Finally, the first speaker responds, saying "Absolutely."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen format with two individuals in separate frames, each engaged in a discussion or presentation. The person on the left is wearing headphones and speaking into a microphone, set against a backdrop of a colorful, abstract design with a globe motif. The individual on the right is dressed in a green jacket and glasses, situated in a room with a bookshelf and a red wall. Between these two frames, there are two smaller images: one shows a person holding a sign that reads "Justice For All," and the other depicts two individuals holding a sign that says "Healthcare for the 99%." The overall setting suggests a discussion or debate on social justice and healthcare issues, with the participants likely sharing their perspectives on these topics. The video maintains a consistent visual style, with no significant changes in the environment or actions of the individuals throughout the sequence.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a conversation between two people. One, a man, expresses gratitude to the other, stating their words define the difference between progressives and corporate democrats, citing that "one side resisting and not really moving anywhere and another side that's trying to push forward", asserting "we want change. We it's it's time to shake things up". The second speaker, another man, responds affirmatively in a similar tone, remarking that "no incumbent is ever going to voluntarily give up the power they have. It's got to be taken", before stating his intentions "to do" this. The first speaker agrees, mentioning, "it's time to go on the offensive". The clip concludes with the first speaker's appreciation, stating the second speaker "have been on that" before the phrase "we you know" ends the clip.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen format with two individuals in separate frames, each engaged in a discussion or presentation. The person on the left is wearing headphones and speaking into a microphone, with a background that includes a colorful, abstract design and a box of cereal. The person on the right is dressed in a green jacket and appears to be in a casual setting with a blurred background. Between these two frames, there are two smaller images. The left image shows a person holding a sign that reads "Justice For All," while the right image depicts two individuals holding a sign that says "Healthcare for the 99%." The overall atmosphere suggests a discussion or debate on social and political issues, with the split-screen format allowing for a dynamic exchange of ideas between the two presenters. The video maintains a consistent visual style throughout, with no significant changes in the environment or actions of the individuals.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker stating that many in the progressive movement understand why Nancy Pelosi is foolish, then asks about specific changes the speaker wants to make in San Francisco, particularly those that are top of mind. The speaker has a measured tone, as if in conversation or an interview.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen interview with two individuals, each in their own frame. The person on the left is wearing headphones and speaking into a microphone, with a background that includes a colorful mural and a box of cereal. The person on the right is wearing a green jacket with a "Jatie" button and glasses, and is situated in a room with various objects, including a bicycle and a calendar on the wall. Between the two individuals, there are two smaller frames showing images of people holding signs with messages such as "Justice For All" and "Healthcare for the 99%," indicating a discussion on social justice and healthcare issues. The video transitions to a close-up of the person on the right, who continues to speak, with the background remaining consistent. The video then returns to the split-screen format, with the person on the left still speaking into the microphone and the person on the right continuing to speak. The smaller frames now show images of people holding signs with messages such as "Shut Down the Dream Act" and "We Are All Immigrants," further emphasizing the theme of social justice and immigration rights. The video concludes with another close-up of the person on the right, who continues to speak, with the background remaining unchanged.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with one male speaker discussing the peculiar issues of San Francisco and local governance, emphasizing two main problems: homelessness and the cost of housing, which he describes as "through the roof" and hard to describe. He notes the problems' intersection and attributes homelessness to evictions and gentrification due to corporate democrats pandering to real estate developers and landlords. He concludes by advocating for federal government involvement and the use of available resources.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing glasses and a green jacket with a 'Jaff' button, speaking in a room filled with various objects, including a bicycle and a calendar. The scene transitions to a split-screen format, showing the man on the right and another individual on the left, who is wearing headphones and speaking into a microphone. The background of the second individual includes a colorful mural and a box of 'Oreo' cookies. In the center of the split-screen, a news broadcast displays a woman in a red jacket standing at a podium with the text 'WE'RE CAPITALISTS AND THAT'S JUST THE WAY IT IS' (We are capitalists and that's just the way it is) on a sign behind her, indicating a political statement. The video then returns to the split-screen format, focusing on the two individuals, with the man in the green jacket continuing to speak on the right and the person with headphones on the left. The background of the second individual remains consistent, featuring the colorful mural and the 'Oreo' box. The video maintains a professional and informative atmosphere throughout, with the split-screen format emphasizing the dialogue between the two speakers.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker discussing his plans to address homelessness if elected, saying he would contact FEMA and the Surgeon General to declare a disaster area and health emergency, respectively. He speaks with a straightforward tone, emphasizing his intention to bring in resources to solve a problem that the city is "unwilling or unable to do."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen video call between two individuals. On the left side, a person with long hair, wearing a black shirt and a gray cardigan, is seated in front of a microphone. Behind them, a colorful background displays a large image of a futuristic eye, surrounded by various objects, including a box labeled "Chump" and a small figurine. On the right side, another individual with short hair, wearing glasses, a green jacket, and a pink shirt, is also seated in front of a microphone. They have a button pinned to their jacket that reads "Jill for President." The background behind them includes a wall with a decorative item and a shelf with various objects. Throughout the video, both individuals appear to be engaged in a conversation, with slight movements and changes in their facial expressions. The overall atmosphere suggests a casual and informal discussion, possibly related to a political campaign, as indicated by the "Jill for President" button.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features two speakers, one male with a slightly sarcastic tone, questioning another male about taking "immediate direct action." The sarcastic speaker jokes about conducting a study and accuses the other of moving too quickly. The second male speaker acknowledges the sarcasm. The sarcastic speaker states his expectation of faster progress in a progressive state, considering the issues of homelessness and inequality. The other speaker agrees that "one would think so."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen video call between two individuals. On the left side, a person with long hair, wearing a black shirt and a gray cardigan, is seated in front of a microphone, with a background that includes a colorful poster and a box labeled "CHOMP." On the right side, another individual with short hair, wearing glasses, a green jacket, and a pink shirt, is also seated in front of a microphone, with a background that includes a wall-mounted bicycle and a poster. Both individuals are wearing headphones and appear to be engaged in a conversation. The video transitions to a close-up of the person on the right, who continues to speak, with the background remaining consistent. The atmosphere suggests a casual and informal setting, likely a discussion or interview.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker suggesting an idea, followed by his lament that things are worsening, illustrated by San Francisco's ineffective budget for homelessness. Another male voice responds, acknowledging the lack of solutions and hinting at the possible influence of real estate interests on Pelosi's donation list. The first speaker confirms, adding that Pelosi raises a lot of money for the party, but doesn’t disclose her benefactors, who are corporations with a stake in the issues discussed not being solved. The second speaker agrees.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen video call between two individuals. On the left side, a person with long hair, wearing headphones and a gray cardigan over a black shirt, speaks into a microphone. The background is a vibrant, colorful room with a large poster of a futuristic cityscape and a box labeled "CHUMP" visible on a shelf. On the right side, an older man with gray hair, glasses, and a green jacket over a pink shirt, is seen wearing a blue button with the text "Jaffa" on it. The background behind him includes a bicycle and various items on a shelf. The video alternates between close-ups of each individual, focusing on their expressions and gestures as they engage in conversation. The split-screen format emphasizes the interaction between the two participants, highlighting their distinct environments and attire.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with two male speakers engaged in a conversation. One speaker is prompting the other to tell the audience where he will be next, mentioning that he is always on the road and asking where they can meet him to show support and hear more from him. The other speaker responds, stating that he will be hitting the streets of San Francisco and that he's been going and running for a year, attending meetings and doing fundraising. He adds that he will be spending most of his time talking to people, handing out literature, and knocking on doors. The first speaker responds with enthusiasm, calling it awesome. He then asks where people can go to support him.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen video call between two individuals. On the left side, a person with long hair, wearing a gray cardigan and headphones, is speaking into a microphone. The background behind them is a vibrant, colorful image of a futuristic cityscape with a large circular structure, possibly a portal or a futuristic building, and various technological elements. On the right side, another individual with short hair, wearing glasses, a green jacket, and a red shirt, is also speaking into a microphone. The background behind them is a more subdued setting with a wall-mounted decoration and a shelf with various items, including a stack of books or boxes. Both individuals appear engaged in a conversation, with slight movements and changes in facial expressions indicating an ongoing dialogue. The overall atmosphere suggests a casual yet focused discussion, possibly related to technology or science fiction, given the visual elements in the background.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker providing website information. He speaks clearly and enthusiastically, offering two different URLs for donation and stressing their presence on Facebook and Twitter. A second male speaker chimes in in agreement, offering additional instruction on how to mention the first male speaker on Twitter to get a response. The second male speaker then suggests that the listeners help the first speaker because his opponent can raise a lot of money and will then proceed to do nothing for them. The first male speaker then returns to add that she votes for donors, not voter constituents.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen video call between two individuals. On the left, a person with long hair, wearing a gray cardigan and headphones, speaks into a microphone, set against a backdrop of a colorful, futuristic-themed wall with a large circular design and various objects. On the right, another individual with short hair, wearing glasses, a green jacket, and a red shirt, is seen in a room with a shelf of colorful items. The conversation appears to be engaging, with both participants actively involved. The video concludes with a logo for "Uphill Media," established in 2017, accompanied by the slogan "Uphill all the way," set against a red background with a glowing effect.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker thanking someone and encouraging them to continue progressive fights. A second male speaker expresses gratitude for being invited back and anticipation for future appearances. The first speaker then suggests doing a town hall or debate with other progressives, mentioning Nancy and inviting her to debate, stating, "Nancy, if you're willing, we're here...or anybody else you'd like to challenge to a debate, call them out right now." The second speaker responds that, "Pelosi has not debated an opponent since 1987." The first speaker then adds, "Here's your chance to practice, Nancy. You're gonna need it." The second speaker agrees, followed by both thanking each other, and then concluding with a "see you later".
